race.name: Alentejo Gravel
race.tagline: Portuguese countryside—120km of cork forests, 1,800m elevation, April warmth, affordable entry.

terrain.surface: 85% gravel, 15% paved roads. Portuguese Alentejo—rolling hills, cork forests. 1,800 m over 120 km. Technical rating: 3/5.

biased_opinion.summary: Alentejo Gravel is Portuguese countryside—120 km, 1,800 m elevation. Founded ~2020. 85% gravel, 15% paved. Portuguese Alentejo—rolling hills, cork forests. 300-500 riders. Alentejo region. April spring conditions (15-25°C). Affordable entry (€80-€120 / $85-$130). If you want Portuguese countryside with cork forests and affordable entry, this is it. If you need local/domestic, skip it. International destination race.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: Alentejo Gravel is Portuguese countryside cork forests. 120 km, 1,800 m, April warmth. If you want Portuguese Alentejo with cork forests and affordable entry, this is it. If you need local/domestic, skip it. International travel required but Portugal makes it worth it. Post-race food/wine.

black_pill.title: INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL + 120KM + LISBON 150KM
black_pill.reality: International travel to Portugal required. Lisbon airport 150 km (2-hour drive). 120 km is long. 1,800 m cumulative elevation. April = 15-25°C. 10-15% DNF. You'll pay €80-€120 ($85-$130) + international travel. If you need local/domestic, this isn't it. If you want Portuguese countryside cork forests with affordable entry, this is it. Travel adds cost but Portugal makes it worth it.
black_pill.expectation_reset: Alentejo Gravel is international destination race. Portugal travel required. 120 km, 1,800 m cumulative. If you need local/domestic, skip it. If you want Portuguese countryside cork forests with affordable entry, this is it. Travel adds cost but Portugal experience is worth it.

logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Lisbon (LIS). Rental car needed (150 km, 2-hour drive to Alentejo). Region lodging—book early. Day-before packet pickup. Race April. Post-race Portuguese food/wine.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party with Portuguese food/wine.

course_description.character: 120 km, 1,800 m. 85% gravel, 15% paved. Portuguese Alentejo—rolling hills, cork forests. Technical rating: 3/5.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Alentejo Rolling Hills
suffering_zones.description: Rolling Portuguese hills. 1,800 m cumulative elevation. Cork forests.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Moderate gears. Steady pace. Cumulative elevation adds up. 120 km long.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: April Warmth
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: 3+ bottles. Sun protection. Hydrate. Start early. Warmth is manageable.

course_description.signature_challenge: 120 km + 1,800 m cumulative elevation. Portuguese Alentejo cork forests.

history.origin_story: Alentejo Gravel founded ~2020. Alentejo, Portugal. 120 km, 300-500 riders. Portuguese countryside cork forests gravel.
history.reputation: Portuguese gravel scene. Alentejo. Cork forests. Well-organized. Affordable entry.
